intro: Samolus ebracteatus subsp. cuneatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandwill, is a low-growing perennial herb native to parts of Asia and Africa. It typically features small, opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
